intro: Currently, I work on the news design team at The Washington Post, where I build rich, highly customized interactive storytelling experiences and web apps.

Previously, I was a data reporting fellow at the Howard Center for Investigative Journalism at the University of Maryland, and have interned at NBC News on the data and graphics team. My code contributions on GitHub in the last year look like this:
If you like to keep up with current events and care about the news — or want to simply chat about trains or nerd out about antique fountain pens — we should connect!

work.name: The Washington Post
work.title: News Designer (Contract), Design and Graphics Intern
work.desc: Collaborate with designers and graphics reporters to design and develop web presentations of enterprise projects. Build bespoke storytelling tools and components for the Post's website. Create interactive graphics for data-driven political stories.

work.name: Howard Center for Investigative Journalism
work.title: Fellow, Data Reporter
work.desc: Ran advanced data analyses in R and Python to develop promising leads and story ideas. Filed public records requests to gather data. Designed and built interactive graphics to supplement storytelling.

work.name: Capital News Service
work.title: Data and Graphics Reporter
work.desc: Designed graphics and programmed interactive maps and visualizations. Built Python web scrapers to automate data collection. Created news apps and long-form web presentations to present data-driven stories in engaging and visual ways.

work.name: NBC News
work.title: Data Graphics Intern
work.desc: Pitched, reported and wrote data-driven stories. Analyzed data sets to develop story ideas. Built engaging charts, maps and graphics for stories to explain the news visually.
